page.title: 13THE ARKLE BECK by PETER
page.content: The{Arkle beck}runs through this area.It starts at the top of the dale approximately 4 miles west of { {Langthwaite village}and runs an attractive course through Arkengarthdale to join the River Swale at Reeth. The course of the beck has changed over the years and the depth of water varies . When the beck is in flood it can be over 1 metre deep. Two places where it is always very deep are called Immy and Wyholm. The beck runs through some attractive woodland and a public{footpath}follows its course for much of the way.In Langthwaite the beck is used to keep ducks. The Lord of the Manor owns the{fishing rights but the beck is not stocked with fish.In 1985 it costs Â£4_50 for an adult fishing licence.
